project.teaser: SYSCHEMIQ will demonstrate how to migrate to a circular urban-industrial cross-border district, i.e. the CHEMELOT Circular Hub (CCH) in the Trilateral Euregio of NL, BE and DE. A Circular Economy Action Plan and a (4BEUR) Investment Agenda (2020-2030) are available...
project.objective: SYSCHEMIQ will demonstrate how to migrate to a circular urban-industrial cross-border district, i.e. the CHEMELOT Circular Hub (CCH) in the Trilateral Euregio of NL, BE and DE. A Circular Economy Action Plan and a (4BEUR) Investment Agenda (2020-2030) are available. Stakeholder involvement schemes are in place, to allow governance within an ecosystem (Regional Government, Municipality, Industries, Educational and Research Institutes, Utilities and Cluster Management): a new way of working to overcome key-bottlenecks. Investment decisions have been made to set up mechanical recycling (4kT/a) and a 150 M€ semi-industrial (18kT/a) chemical pilot recycling plant, to run demos with optimised real-life Mixed Plastic Waste (MPW) streams. We will demo systemic solutions 1) a novel Dual-Track multistakeholder governance model, underpinned by the recently developed Plastic Recycling Impact Scenario: PRISM model (TRL6), and CIMS digital-twin 2) the CCH circular governance model (TRL6), 3) community-based innovation schemes; a Circular City Lab, citizens incentives schemes, incubator and novel skills development and innovation programmes with students (vocational, professional and academic) in a Circular Learning Lab (CHILL), 4) new plastic waste collection, sorting standards/protocols and technologies (e.g. prototype sorting line TRL6) for alignment of material flows in the value chain, 5) new Design rules (TRL 5) for plastic packaging products favouring mechanical and chemical recycling. Considering circa 1.1 Mt of MPW in NL and 30 Mt in EU, scenario calculations promise huge savings of 11.4 Mt CO2 eq./a and 190 kT/a virgin polyolefins. Business modelling and upscaling study will prepare investments in a 100-400 kT/a full-scale recycling facility. A structured Twinning programme with at least 5 selected regions (incl. Flanders and Lombardy), will foster replication, with the support of EU Platform organisations (ECRN, PRE) and in collaboration with the CCRI.
project.title: Demonstrator of systemic solutions for the territorial deployment of the circular economy in the Trilateral Chemical Region with a focus on plastic waste streams Quality for Recycling

article.title: Demonstrating methodologies for transitioning to circular economies

result.title: Report on qualitative and quantitative analysis on in-depth interviews and case studies
result.description: Result from Task 4.1: Report defining citizens’ behavioural biases, the status of capability, opportunity and motivations that could generate behavioural change towards plastic recycling

result.title: Methodology report Governance Support Systems: Design 1.0
result.description: Result of Task 1.1.: Design (configure, assemble) a methodological approach for Dual Track Governance Support Systems in circular, transitional settings, based on amongst others the PRISM and QR tools.

result.title: Quick scan of economic and environmental performance of plastics recycling pathways
result.description: Result from Task 7-2: Report outlining economic and environmental impact of plastics recycling taking into account new technologies and circular governance

result.title: Plastic recycling stripped naked – from circular product to circular industry with recycling cascade

details.authors: Jean‐Paul Lange, Sascha R. A. Kersten, Steven De Meester, Marcel C. P. van Eijk, Kim Ragaert

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SYSCHEMIQ (Demonstrator of systemic solutions for the territorial deployment of the circular economy in the Trilateral Chemical Region with a focus on plastic waste streams Quality for Recycling)
result.teaser: The SYSCHEMIQ project aims to revolutionize plastic recycling in the Trilateral Rhine-Meuse region (NL, BE, DE) by aligning regional stakeholders towards establishing a circular urban-industrial plastics district. This initiative integrates new chemical recycling (CR)...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: EU Regions stakeholders' map and MoUs with relevant Plastics twinning regions
result.description: Result from Task 8.3: Report mapping regions and industrial clusters throughout the EU and analysing ongoing (plastics) recycling and regional circular economic action plans (CEAP) and activities.

result.title: SYSCHEMIQ DTG Knowledge tools framework for replication
result.description: Result from Task 8.5: Report describing tools and framework developed for carrying out Dual Track Governance workshops in Flanders (B), North Rhein WestPhalia (D) and Lombardia (IT). A candidate framework is the Boundary Work framework van Myrthe Velter by MSI

result.title: Local plastic re-use, collection and separation experiment and awareness program (including digital coin remuneration programme)
result.description: Result from Task 4.2: Report on awareness program aimed at environmental savvy consumers and benchmarking of the existing social circular practices around plastics.

result.title: Perceptions and alignment on quality along the circular plastics packaging material chain

details.authors: Merel Molenbuur, Marcel C.P. van Eijk, Jan Harm Urbanus, Henk Diepenmaat, Kim Ragaert

result.title: Multi-actor governance model, features and proposed actions: V1.0
result.description: Result of Task 1.2, 1.3 and 1.4: . First version of the case report Multi-actor governance model (Zuyd), Longlist of salient governance features, positioned on the multi-actor governance model of the CCH ecosystem (UM) and Shortlist of proposed actions for the CCH ecosystem (TNO). The shortlist is to be presented to the governmental board (that will be involved during the road)

result.title: Communication Plan and report V1.0
result.description: Result from Task 8.2 : Report to outline plans for communication ongoing the implementation of the project : this will include amongst others project identify, website and materials, (online) events, webinars, and meetings, regional (media) communication campaign to support transition in the tri-lateral region and Chemelot Circular Hub initiatives on introducing large scale plastics recycling and scientific Publications

result.title: Report and PRISM GIS tool: Scenarios and forecasts
result.description: Result from Task 7.1: Report includingspatial determination of quantities and qualities of current and future plastic and bio waste streams in the tri-lateral ARRRA region

result.title: JOINT CCRI deliverable - SYSCHEMIQ Policy briefs and guidelines on the circular systemic solutions adopted, including their strengths and weaknesses experienced
result.description: Result from Task 8.5 and 8.6: Report with SWOT of SyschemiQ innovations, and proposed governance actions, including results and learning experiences from DTG workshop in M18, and coordinated with clustering activities (other EU funded projects and CCRI), as a basis for dissemination and further replication of the SyschemiQ learning experiences towards other regional innovation eco-systems (as mapped under D8.5). Targeted audience will be regional policy makers (policy feedback), and other stakeholders (industry, research and civil society organisations) in line with the Dual Track Governance concept, as well as national and European policy makers dealing with circular economy. To be confirmed during the project. This deliverable will describe potential synergies and joint achievements with the project TREASOURCE which is issued from the same topic (CIRCBIO-01-01). The nature of the joint work will be further defined during the project but may include joint policy feedback such as policy brief or white paper.

result.title: Monitoring Antioxidant Consumption and Build-Up in Polypropylene During Open-Loop and Closed-Loop Mechanical Recycling

details.authors: Niek Knoben, Max Vanhouttem, Aike Wypkema, Nithya Subramanian

category.title: recycling
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/environmental engineering/waste management/waste treatment processes/recycling

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
